title: Sure feels good to report all 4 people on your team...

replies.body:
You only get the feedback popup if: 

1) it was an automated ban
2) your report was the last one before the ban

They could still have been manually banned, or managed to play another game before the ban took place, and in neither case you'd get a feedback popup. Also even if your report didn't directly trigger a ban, they can still weight down the line the next time they get toxic (and chances are that will happen sooner rather than later).

> you get a pop up even if you aren't the last person, if they're toxic often you'll get one in a few days to a few weeks

No, to get a report, you have to be the last person that reported them. If you get a report with days of delay, that probably that only means it took that long for the ban to happen for some reason and they haven't been reported by anyone afterwards. I'm 100% sure of that because I remember Lyte using saying something along the lines of "just like you only get the kill if you make the last hit" when explaining it, that was quite memorable. It was a podcast so I can't really source it though (searching through audio is impossible unfortunately), so feel free to disbelieve me.


EDIT: found another quote from him: 

>we were concerned about the Report Feedback system being a bit spammy, so **we're only letting the system send pop-ups when it is your report that is the final trigger**.


https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3cf5ky/i_have_never_seen_the_successful_player/csvhgtq/

hmm.. slightly interpreted incorrectly, you don't have to " last hit report" them to get the notification. you just need to "last game report".  Multiple people can get that notification in the same game. 

I've experienced that myself where the enemy lee sin was using hate sspeech, I reported him and was just having a chat with the enemy support. In the middle of the conversation, I got a punishment notification , and the enemy support went "omg!! I got a punishment notification for reporting lee sin!!"
It all works on the basis of games reported, not individual reports, so it should been obvious.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gambler's_fallacy

>_The gambler's fallacy, also known as the Monte Carlo fallacy or the fallacy of the maturity of chances, is the mistaken belief that, if something happens more frequently than normal during some period, it will happen less frequently in the future, or that, if something happens less frequently than normal during some period, it will happen more frequently in the future_
